entries.title: U.S. Pursues India as a Supply-Chain Alternative to China
entries.description: The Biden administration turns to New Delhi as it seeks to steer critical technologies away from Beijing.

entries.title: U.S. Says Russia Has Violated Nuclear-Arms Treaty
entries.description: Tensions over Russia’s invasion of Ukraine risk endangering cooperation on arms control and negotiating a successor to the New START treaty.

entries.title: French Workers Mount New Strike Against Macron's Pension Overhaul
entries.description: Striking teachers and railway, health and oil workers staged marches in dozens of cities as a part of a nationwide day of action called by unions to force the government to back down.

entries.title: Iran's Deadly Street Protests Are Replaced by Quiet Acts of Rebellion
entries.description: Arrests and executions have smothered organized demonstrations, yet thousands of women in Tehran have abandoned compulsory headscarves in protest.

entries.title: Pakistan Suicide Bombing Death Toll Rises to At Least 95
entries.description: Rescuers worked through the night pulling victims from the rubble of a mosque hit by one of the country’s deadliest terror attacks.

entries.title: U.S., South Korea to Step Up Nuclear Deterrence Efforts Against North Korea
entries.description: Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin said the U.S. and South Korea would hold larger-scale and longer joint military exercises than their previous ones.

entries.title: Pope Pursues Quest for Peace in Congo, South Sudan
entries.description: The pontiff is visiting two conflict-torn African countries where the Catholic Church exercises outsize influence.

entries.title: In Besieged Bakhmut, Everyday Life Is a Struggle to Survive
entries.description: A city of some 80,000 before the war, Bakhmut is now home to barely a few thousand who face a daily struggle to survive, as Russian forces press forward house by house and bombard it with artillery.

entries.title: CBD Gummies, Beer Are Trashed as Hong Kong Bans Cannabis Compound
entries.description: People are dumping their CBD products ahead of a new Hong Kong law that criminalizes possession of the cannabis derivative, ranking it alongside heroin and cocaine.

entries.title: Ukraine Fends Off Russian Assault in the East
entries.description: Kyiv said it had repelled multiple Russian attacks around Bakhmut, as Moscow’s troops pushed to encircle the besieged city.

entries.title: Eurozone Economy Outpaced China and U.S. in 2022
entries.description: The figures underline how the fading Covid-19 pandemic continues to scramble traditional patterns of global growth.

entries.title: Blinken Set to Meet Palestinian Leader Abbas as Tensions Flare
entries.description: The U.S. Secretary of State will meet Palestinian Authority President Mahmoud Abbas to press for calm after a surge in violence in the West Bank and Jerusalem.

entries.title: U.S. Pushes for Military Sites in Philippines to Counter China
entries.description: Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin plans to meet this week with Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr.
